sipa have you given any thought to having some logging when txgraph reports a non-optimal graph (say after a DoWork) to track if it happens. I guess what would be useful for diagnostics?
instagibbs: i hadn't really thought about that, but for debugging that seems useful
not as a default log level though
right, mempool topic only
topic, or label, whatever we call them

For the instance in Apply() I think it could make sense just to say it ended up being non-optimal, and based on how many times you see this log you along with other mempool messages can probably reconstruct a cluster and reason about how much time was spent?

could also easily query done-ness in an RPC with a DoWork(0)...

sigh
txgraph tracks whether clusters are optimal too, so it could expose it, making it RPC-queryable?
sighing at the spam not you
yeah I think DoWork(0) is literally this
in round about way
(if we know were not oversized which we should not be at call sites we have)
ah right, but DoWork() doesn't tell you which cluster is suboptimal
true, knowing which one then being able to query it would be nice
vs reconstructing from logs and data mining
